first
good morning

as new servers and equipment were employed older servers

to gain as full understanding as possible of the ways in which personal email was used for government work has been a painstaking undertaking

for example
when one of secretary Clinton's servers was decommissioned in two thousand and thirteen
the email software was removed
that didn't remove the email content

the effect was that millions of email fragments ended up
in the servers unused or slack space
we search through all of it
to understand what was there and what parts of the puzzle we could put back together again
FBI investigators also read all
of the approximately thirty thousand emails that secretary Clinton
provided to the state department in two thousand fourteen
wherein email was assessed as possibly containing classified information
the FBI referred that email to any government agency that might be an owner of that information
so that agency can make a determination as to whether the email contained classified information

or whether there was reason to classify it now even if the content had not been classified when it was first center received and that's the process sometimes referred to as up classifying
from the group of thirty thousand emails returned to the state department into thousand fourteen
one hundred and ten emails
in fifty two email chains
I've been determined by the owning agency to contain classified information at the time they were sent or received
eight of those chains contained information that was top secret at the time they were sent

about two thousand additional emails
work up classified to make them confidential
those emails had not been classified at the time that they were sent to received

state in two thousand fourteen
we found those emails in a variety of ways

this helped us recover work related emails that were not among the thirty thousand that were produced to state

dumped into the slack space of the server that was decommissioned in two thousand thirteen
with respect to the thousands of emails we found that were not among those produced to the state department
agencies have concluded that three of those were classified at the time they were sent or received one of the secret level into that the confidential level
there were no additional top secret emails found and finally none of those we found have since been up classified
I should add here that we found no evidence that any of the additional work related emails were intentionally deleted

our assessment is that like many email users

it's highly likely

and done technical examination

we believe our investigation has been sufficient to give us reasonable confidence
there was no intentional misconduct in connection with that sorting effort

the staff members of whom she corresponded by email to those involved in email production to state and finally secretary Clinton herself

now let me tell you what we found

there is evidence that they were extremely careless

seven email chains concern matters that were classified at the top secret
special access program at the time they were sent and received
those chains involved secretary Clinton both sending emails about those matters
in receiving emails about those same matters
there is evidence to support a conclusion

only a very small number of the emails here containing classified information bore markings

but even if information is not marked classified in an email

and while not the focus of our investigation we also developed evidence that the security culture of the state department
in general and with respect to the use of unclassified systems in particular
was generally lacking in the kind of care for classified information that's found elsewhere in the U. S. government
with respect to potential computer intrusion by hostile actors

the prosecutors make the decisions

responsible decisions also consider the context of a person's actions

we cannot find a case

all the cases prosecute
involved some combination of

we do not see those things here
